item.title: Whats wrong with this? - fixed
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

[quote=“ownageownt, post:12, topic:183093”]Lol try this

public void isBannedName() { String bannedNameEndsWith[] = { " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " " }; String bannedNameStartsWith[] = { "sham" }; for(int name = 0; name < bannedNameEndsWith[name].length(); name++) { appendToBanned(playerName); } for(int name = 0; name < bannedNameStartsWith[name].length(); name++) { appendToBanned(playerName); } }

Don’t know if it will work, I’m too lazy to try it out.[/quote]

of course it wont work =P you have to have the playername.w\e
and if you just have the playerName their itll ban everyone that logs on

edit: and i fixed my way not to sure if i need the exception cus last time i think i added it before the try in run()

ublic void isBannedName() { String bannedNameEndsWith[] = { " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " " }; String bannedNameStartsWith[] = { "sham" }; String bannedNameEquals[] = { "" }; int i = 0; int BNEW = bannedNameEndsWith[i].length(); int BNSW = bannedNameStartsWith[i].length(); int BNE = bannedNameEquals[i].length(); try { for(int name = 0; name < BNEW; name++) { if(playerName.endsWith(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameEndsWith[name]); } } for(int name = 0; name < BNSW; name++) { if(playerName.startsWith(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameStartsWith[name]); } } for(int name = 0; name < BNE; name++) { if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameEquals[name]); } } } catch(Exception e) {} }

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with this? - fixed
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

yep actuly my way is way glitched =P way better way now
it needs the startswith endswith ect… or else it wont know what its doing

public void isBannedName() { int i = 0; String bannedNameEndsWith[] = { " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " " }; String bannedNameStartsWith[] = { "sham" }; String bannedNameEquals[] = { "" }; int BNEW = bannedNameEndsWith[i].length(); int BNSW = bannedNameStartsWith[i].length(); int BNE = bannedNameEquals[i].length(); for(int name = 0; name < BNEW; name++) { if(playerName.endsWith(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameEndsWith[name]); } } for(int name = 0; name < BNSW; name++) { if(playerName.startsWith(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameStartsWith[name]); } } for(int name = 0; name < BNE; name++) { if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameEquals[name]); } } }

item.title: Whats wrong with this? - fixed
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

errors

.\Java\client.java:7329: appendToBanned(java.lang.String) in client cannot be ap plied to (int) appendToBanned(name); ^ .\Java\client.java:7332: appendToBanned(java.lang.String) in client cannot be ap plied to (int) appendToBanned(name); ^ Note: .\Java\stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

code

public void isBannedName() { String bannedNameEndsWith[] = { " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " " }; String bannedNameStartsWith[] = { "sham" }; for(int name = 0; name < bannedNameEndsWith[name].length(); name++) { appendToBanned(name); } for(int name = 0; name < bannedNameStartsWith[name].length(); name++) { appendToBanned(name); } }

if your smart enough youll know what im trying to do

fixed version

ublic void isBannedName() { String bannedNameEndsWith[] = { " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " ", " " }; String bannedNameStartsWith[] = { "sham" }; String bannedNameEquals[] = { "" }; int i = 0; int BNEW = bannedNameEndsWith[i].length(); int BNSW = bannedNameStartsWith[i].length(); int BNE = bannedNameEquals[i].length(); try { for(int name = 0; name < BNEW; name++) { if(playerName.endsWith(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameEndsWith[name]); } } for(int name = 0; name < BNSW; name++) { if(playerName.startsWith(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameStartsWith[name]); } } for(int name = 0; name < BNE; name++) { if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(bannedNameEndsWith[name]) && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("shamon king")) { appendToBanned(bannedNameEquals[name]); } } } catch(Exception e) {} }

Read full topic
